medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was in her usual state of health until the day prior when she underwent a colonoscopy and polypectomy. She experienced vomiting once after the procedure but had no pain until 5 AM the following morning when she awoke with severe generalized abdominal pain, described as distinctly different from her typical pain experienced from prior ruptured ovarian cysts, which occur several times per year. The pain was well controlled with morphine upon arrival at the emergency department around noon.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypothyroidism, pre-diabetes, history of ruptured ovarian cysts occurring several times per year, umbilical hernia repair as an infant.
